value.title: Analyzing a slow report query in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Investigate a slow query in a Power BI report using DAX Studio, looking at the query plan and the server timings. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ Optimizing DAX Workshop: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/optimizing-dax-video-course/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/C5HBhlLUFsE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Disabling auto date-time in Power BI
value.excerpt: This video shows how to disable the date table automatically created by Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/137706
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/xu3uDEHtCrg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS in DAX
value.excerpt: Improve DAX queries by using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS when you create table expressions. Article and video: https://sql.bi/54337?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Using USERELATIONSHIP in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to use the USERELATIONSHIP function in DAX to change the active relationship in a CALCULATE function. Article and download: https://sql.bi/664175

In todays video, I will show you how to do that with the smart narrative visual and some dax.  Here you can download all the pbix

value.title: DAX Fridays! #124: Weekly time intelligence in Power BI
value.excerpt: Are you also bummed out that there is no weekly time intelligence in DAX? Believe it or not, creating weekly calculations is easier than you think, and I show you how in this edition of #DAXfridays.   #DAX #Powerbi #curbal    Are you in a hurry? Skip the talk and go right to it:  01:06 Calculate Weekly

value.title: DAX Fridays! #13: EARLIER
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function EARLIER in DAX/ Powerpivot.  Link to pbix and excel file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/earlier-dax  EARLIER is mostly used in the context of calculated columns.  The performance of EARLIER might be slow because it theoretically, it might have to perform a number of operations

value.title: DAX Fridays! #132: Dynamic TopN + Others in Power BI
value.excerpt: I was recently asked to do a TopN + Others for a customer and in this video I will share my solution with you. #curbal #dax #daxfridays #powerbi  Link to RANX video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z2qzJVeYhTY Gerhard post: https://blog.gbrueckl.at/2019/05/power-bi-dynamic-topn-others-with-drill-down/

value.title: DAX Fridays! #14: SUMMARIZE
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function SUMMARIZE in DAX/ Powerpivot.  The function SUMMARIZE can return a summary of sales grouped around the calendar year and the product category name, this result table allows you to do analysis over the reseller sales by year and product category.  Source:https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg492171.aspx

value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show you how to split text by a character using DAX and why this search error happens and how to solve it: The search Text provided to function 'SEARCH' could not be found in the given text. value.title: DAX! Uggg - Where do you start? | Power BI
value.excerpt: Not a coder? Don't understand DAX syntax? DAX can be intimidating and difficult to learn. Frustrating even! Learning DAX can make Power BI very rewarding. Adam has some resources to get you started in your journey.  Beginning the journey:  MS Learn: User DAX in Power BI Desktop (Free) https://docs.microsoft.com/learn/paths/dax-power-bi/
